reportInfo:
Purpose:

This report compares large aggregations of students across organizational boundaries. The Achievement Level proportion bars provide a standardized way to view assessment results in a common format that describes their overall performance.


Uses:

  • Use this view to compare summary performance of a large aggregation (e.g. school, district, state).
  • Keep in mind that the number of students assessed is an important part of any analysis.

Features:

  • Align proportion bars by end-points or by the Level 3 cut-score.
  • Sort aggregations by any column:
    • Name
    • Proportion of students at or above Level 3
    • Number of students tested
  • Filter aggregations by student attributes:
    • Grade or multiple grades
    • Gender and/or Ethnicity
    • Limited English Proficient (LEP)
    • Disadvantaged status (Title 1)
    • Disability (504/IEP)

legendInfo.desc3: The width of a colored segment is proportional to the number of students in that segment.
notes: Rollover/Tap bar for breakdown of population numbers
Percentages are rounded to the nearest whole number. Therefore, small percentages may be reported as '0'.
